text: William Henry Rorke (October 23, 1910 â€“ August 19, 1987) was an American actor. He was born in Brooklyn, New York. He was best known for playing Colonel Dr. Alfred E. Bellows on the 1960s American sitcom I Dream of Jeannie. Rorke died on August 19, 1987 at his home in Toluca Lake, California of multiple myeloma at the age of 76. In a 2011 memoir by Jeannie co-star Barbara Eden revealed that Rorke was "unashamed to be gay" and that they were close friends. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1910 births Category:1987 deaths Category:Deaths from multiple myeloma Category:Cancer deaths in Los Angeles Category:LGBT actors Category:Gay men Category:American movie actors Category:American television actors Category:American stage actors Category:Actors from Brooklyn Category:LGBT people from New York City
title: Hayden Rorke
